intro: Nesocodon, commonly known as the "butterfly orchid," is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. They are characterized by their delicate, often colorful flowers that resemble butterflies, hence their common name. Nesocodon species typically grow as epiphytes or terrestrials, often found in shaded, humid environments. Their botanical features include linear leaves and intricate floral structures that attract specific pollinators.
